most_active_tickets.title: Discord link provided is invalid on the website
Discord link provided is invalid in Pieces OS

common_issues.title: Invalid Discord Invite Links Across Pieces Platforms
common_issues.description: Multiple reports indicate invalid Discord invite links on the Pieces website, documentation, and Pieces OS app.  The links provided include discord.gg/getpieces, discord.com/invite/getpieces, and discord.gg/ubn8JFAXQ7.  A permanent, non-expiring invite link should be created and implemented across all platforms.

related_issues.title: Discord link provided is invalid on the website
related_issues.text:
Discord link provided is invalid on the website
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Marketing Site (pieces.app)

### Operating System / Platform

Web

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The main Pieces website [page](<https://pieces.app>) offers the following Discord invite link: <https://discord.gg/getpieces>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/106f7b8e-0f74-4efa-a6ec-9cfe48133198)

The support [page](<https://docs.pieces.app/products/support>) of Pieces documentation website offers the following Discord invite link: <https://discord.com/invite/getpieces>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/87064aff-9a18-420f-bb9f-a86e358e3dea)

Both of the above Discord invite links are invalid. You should create one without an expiration date and replace all those.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Discord link provided is invalid in Pieces OS
related_issues.text:
Discord link provided is invalid in Pieces OS
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS app offers the following Discord invite link: <https://discord.gg/ubn8JFAXQ7>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/894385e1-db70-49fc-8f48-f5abafadeac0)

The above Discord invite link is invalid. You should create one without an expiration date and replace it.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Create a permanent Discord invite link and update it across all platforms (website, documentation, Pieces OS).
Investigate and resolve the invalid Discord link issue reported by users.
Prioritize bug fixes related to core functionalities like Discord integration to improve user experience.
Monitor and address user-reported issues promptly to maintain a positive user experience and minimize negative impact on user engagement.
Consider improving the process of generating and managing Discord invite links to avoid similar issues in the future.
Centralize communication channels to ensure consistent information sharing across different platforms and avoid confusion among users.
Regularly test all links and functionalities on different platforms (website, documentation, Pieces OS) to catch and fix issues proactively.
Implement a system for tracking and managing user feedback to identify recurring issues and prioritize bug fixes accordingly.
Improve documentation and support resources to guide users on how to access and utilize the Discord community effectively.
Encourage users to report issues through designated channels to streamline the support process and gather valuable feedback for improvement.
